response.overview: The full, uncut live footage of DAY 2 from the two Knebworth shows performed by the British rock band Oasis at the height of their career in 1996 will be screened on the big screen.  Held on August 10 and 11, 1996, at Knebworth Park in Hertfordshire, this outdoor concert sold out within 24 hours and drew more than 250,000 people over the two days. It is known as one of the largest-scale live events in British history. On stage, Oasis performed many of their most iconic and beloved songs, including “Live Forever,” “Wonderwall,” “Whatever,” and “Don’t Look Back in Anger,” making it a legendary concert that remains in music history.  Following the 2024 theatrical release of DAY 1, Oasis: Live at Knebworth 1996.8.10, this film presents the August 11 DAY 2 performance in a newly remastered 4K digital version. Audiences can relive the band’s peak-era performance through immersive visuals and sound.
response.tagline: “Knebworth for me was the Woodstock of Nineties. It was all about music and people. I can't remember much about It, but I'll never forget it”
response.title: oasis Knebworth 1996: Day2 Sunday 11th August
